intro: Aspilia dewevrei, commonly known as the African flame bush, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, fiery red bracts that surround its small yellow flowers, creating a dramatic visual display. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats. Aspilia dewevrei is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
